com.redhat.rhn.taskomatic.core

Class BaseDaemon

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.redhat.rhn.taskomatic.core.BaseDaemon
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    TaskomaticDaemon, TestDaemon

    public abstract class BaseDaemon
extends java.lang.Object
    This is the base implementation for all RHN Java daemons. It serves at the interface between the Tanuki service/daemon wrapper library and also provides very basic lifecycle callbacks.

    • Method Detail

      • start

        public java.lang.Integer start(java.lang.String[] argv)
        Interface method required by WrapperListener
        Parameters:
        argv - Arguments configured in the daemon's config file
        Returns:
        Integer indicating status (null indicates success, else value indicates error code)

      • stop

        public int stop(int code)
        Interface method required by WrapperListener
        Parameters:
        code - int
        Returns:
        int

      • controlEvent

        public void controlEvent(int event)
        Interface method required by WrapperListener
        Parameters:
        event - int

      • logMessage

        public void logMessage(int logLevel,
              java.lang.String msg,
              java.lang.Throwable err)
        Convenience method to allow daemon implementations to log messages directly to the host system's system log, ie not log4j or commons-logging. If a java.lang.Throwable is passed in then the stack trace will be logged as well.
        Parameters:
        logLevel - Desired log level
        msg - Message to log
        err - Optional

      • registerImplementation

        protected void registerImplementation(java.lang.String[] argv)
        Registers the daemon implementation with the Tanuki wrapper
        Parameters:
        argv - startup parameters (if any)

      • buildOptionsList

        protected Options buildOptionsList()
        Creates the "master" list of options which the daemon implementation knows about. Implementations should override this method if they need param parsing.
        Returns:
        org.apache.commons.cli.Options instance populated with options or null if no options

      • onOptionsParseError

        protected int onOptionsParseError(ParseException e)
        Lifecycle method called when startup parameters cannot be parsed. This gives the daemon implementation an opportunity to do something about the error such as display a usage message.
        Parameters:
        e -
        Returns:
        int indicates error code. If BaseDaemon.SUCCESS is returned, then the framework will still try to start the daemon implementation _without_ parameters.

      • onStartup

        protected abstract int onStartup(CommandLine commandLine)
        Lifecycle method called when the daemon implementation is started. This method _must_ return otherwise the daemon will appear to hang at startup. This implies that all "real" work needs to be done in a separate thread.
        Parameters:
        commandLine - Parsed params, if present. Otherwise null.
        Returns:
        int indicates status where BaseDaemon.SUCCESS indicates success and any other number indicates failure

      • onShutdown

        protected abstract int onShutdown(boolean breakFromUser)
        Lifecycle method called when the daemon implementation is stopped.
        Parameters:
        breakFromUser - True if the user sent a Ctrl-C
        Returns:
        int indicates status where BaseDaemon.SUCCESS indicates success and any other number indicates an error
